sources.data_found: HPC3 Cluster: Described as a community cluster with 'over 20,000 CPU cores and over 500 GPUs' (as of verified service description 2024).

student_data.notes: Undergraduate count is the sum of 'Computer Science' (2745) and 'Computer Science & Engineering' (470) majors from the Donald Bren School of ICS Facts page (Fall 2023). Total School of ICS undergrad enrollment is higher (4,374) but includes Informatics/Stats; only CS-specific majors included here. Grad count includes MS Computer Science (approx 558). PhD count is for Computer Science (305) and Software Engineering (107) combined. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Listed as a standard purchase option (4x A30 per node); estimated 12 nodes based on 'free-gpu' and departmental partition usage.
Legacy 'condo' nodes from individual labs still active in the cluster.

gpu_resources.notes:
UCI's RCIC operates a 'Condo' model (PI-owned nodes) named HPC3. Total GPU count is officially stated as 'over 500'. 

Calculations/Estimates based on this total + Hardware Purchase Options:
1) A100 80GB: The standard 'High End' option. Estimated 30 nodes x 4 GPUs = 120.
2) V100: The previous standard (HPC3 launched 2020). Estimated 50 nodes x 4 GPUs = 200.
3) A100 40GB: Estimated 10 nodes x 4 GPUs = 40 (earlier A100 acquisitions).
4) Other (P100/A30/RTX): The remaining ~140 GPUs filling out the '500+' total.

Note: No public documentation confirms the presence of H100/H200 nodes in the centralized HPC3 cluster as of early 2025; they may exist in private lab setups not connected to the SLURM grid.

analysis_notes: UCI separates CS majors from the broader ICS school; specific major counts used. GPU data relies on the aggregate '500+' figure provided by OIT/RCIC and standard node configurations (4x GPU) found in purchasing documentation, as a real-time node inventory is not public.
